intro: Seriphium cernuum, commonly known as the nodding hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green to brown bracts, and it produces small, elongated seeds. Seriphium cernuum is often found in the western United States and parts of Canada.
